Arrow pointing to 'FAKE' = exposé, revealing deception
Clickbait techniques employed: High contrast, shadowy 'mystery' figure to invoke curiosity/fear
Split-screen showing both the criminal and the crime scene

THUMBNAIL-TITLE RELATIONSHIP.Reinforcement: The thumbnail visually embodies the core questions from the title. The left image symbolizes the shadowy, anonymous nature of call center scammers, underscoring secrecy/criminal intent, while the right side shows an actual call center (the operational aspect), illustrating 'how' the crime happens. The arrow and 'FAKE AMAZON SCRIPT' give a direct clue to the specific scam type, matching the title's promise to explain.
THUMBNAIL-TITLE RELATIONSHIP.Contrasts/mismatches: There is no significant mismatch; the thumbnail is cohesive and directly relevant to the title. It delivers on both the crime ('SCAMS', 'CRIME') and the behind-the-scenes process ('How Crime Works', exposed with the call center photo). The contrast between anonymous criminal and real-world workplace also serves as a creative visual metaphor for the hidden crime within normal-looking business settings.
